data.name: NotAllowedOverOpening
data.value: Please do not run MCServerLauncher WPF repeatedly.

data.name: DownloadModule_MSLAPIGetCoreDescriptionFailed
data.value: Failed to fetch the core description!

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectMinecraftBedrockArchive_Title
data.value: Compressed package for Minecraft Bedrock Edition

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectArchive_Description
data.value: Please import the downloaded zip file here. If you don't know where to download, click the button on the right to jump.

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectMinecraftJavaCore_Description
data.value: Please select the core file that this server will use. If you don't know where to download it, click the button on the right to jump.

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectMinecraftJavaJvm_Description
data.value: The Java runtime is required for the Minecraft Java server. Be sure to select the appropriate version to prevent startup failures.

data.name: ScanJavaAtDaemon
data.value: Automatically scan on the Daemon host

data.name: MinecraftJavaRequirementTip
data.value:
1.12+ requires Java 8
1.17+ requires Java 16
1.18+ requires Java 17
1.20.5+ requires Java 21

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectOtherExecutableInstanceDependency_Description
data.value: Please select the file/folder/compressed package required for this new instance. The compressed package only supports ZIP format.

data.name: RunCommandArgumentTip
data.value: If additional arguments are required, \nsimply append them to the end.

data.name: CreateInstance_SetInstanceName_Description
data.value: Do not include special symbols or use illegal names.

data.name: CreateInstance_SetMinecraftJavaJvmArgument_Description
data.value: (Optional) You can add additional JVM arguments here, one per line.

data.name: CreateInstance_SetMinecraftJvmRam_Description
data.value: This determines how much memory your Minecraft Java Edition server will be able to use.

data.name: CreateInstance_SetMinecraftJvmRam_Tip
data.value: Minimum memory should always be smaller than maximum memory

data.name: PreFinishCreateInstanceTip
data.value: After completing the following configuration, click "Continue".

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectMinecraftVersionTip
data.value: Please select the version of Minecraft that this server will run.

data.name: CreateInstance_BmclapiMayBeFailedTip
data.value: If it doesn't load, please try again later. \nMirror service powered by BMCLAPI

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectForgeVersion_Description
data.value: Please select the Forge Loader version of the server.

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectNeoForgeVersion_Description
data.value: Please select the NeoForge Loader version of the server.

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectFabricVersion_Description
data.value: Please select the Fabric Loader version of the server.

data.name: CreateInstance_SelectQuiltVersion_Description
data.value: Please select the Quilt Loader version of the server.

data.name: Eula1
data.value: Welcome to MCServerLauncher by MCSLTeam.\nThank you for choosing the software and services provided by MCSLTeam (hereinafter referred to as "the software"). To protect user rights and interests, please carefully read all contents of this agreement before using the software. We reserve the right to update this agreement at any time, and upon publication, the updated agreement will supersede any previous versions.\nBy using this software, you acknowledge that you have read and understood all terms and conditions of this agreement and agree to be bound by them.

data.name: Eula3
data.value:
Users shall provide the necessary hardware and software configurations required for this software and its functionalities (including but not limited to creating new instances).
Users shall bear any costs associated with connecting to the Internet, such as telephone and broadband usage fees.
Users shall be solely responsible for all actions, events, and consequences arising from their use of this software.
Any transactions and disputes between users and unauthorized non-official individuals are not the responsibility of the developers.
Users must comply with the laws and regulations of the PRC (if the user is outside the PRC, they must also comply with the laws and regulations of their country or region).
Users may not use this Software (or any of its features) to engage in illegal activities or use any related processes and services in an unlawful manner. The developers are not liable for any consequences resulting from such behavior.
Users are solely responsible for the legal consequences of any information they publish. Users must not input, post, or disseminate any of the following content within this Software or any related processes and services:

Content opposing the fundamental principles established by the Constitution of the PRC.
Content endangering national security, disclosing state secrets, subverting state power, or undermining national unity.
Content damaging the national honor and interests.
Content inciting ethnic hatred or discrimination and disrupting ethnic unity.
Content undermining national religious policies, promoting cults, or feudal superstitions.
Rumors that disrupt social order or undermine social stability.
Obscene, pornographic, gambling-related, violent, murderous, or terrorist content, or content inciting criminal activities.
Content defaming others or infringing on the legal rights and interests of others.
Any other content prohibited by the laws and administrative regulations of the PRC.
Unless permitted by law or granted written permission by the developers, users shall not engage in any of the following behaviors:
Using this software and its services in an illegal or improper manner.
Damaging the normal operation of this software system or website by deliberately spreading malicious software, such as computer viruses.
Engaging in any non-normal usage of the network services that could affect this software (including but not limited to damaging or overloading servers).
Removing copyright notices from this software or its copies.

If a user engages in any unlawful or breach-of-agreement conduct, the developers reserve the right to take appropriate measures based on the severity of the violation, including but not limited to terminating service. In cases of severe violations, the matter will be referred to relevant administrative authorities for administrative penalties or criminal prosecution.

data.name: Eula5
data.value:
If you agree to this agreement and use the online services provided by this software, we may collect the following information:
The IP address of the device on which this software is running (note that this may not always be accurate). 
Certain system information about the device on which this software is running. 
In the event of a software crash, with your consent, we may upload system logs (containing some system information) to help diagnose and resolve issues and improve the software. 
Other information may be uploaded with your consent (specific details will be provided within the software).

data.name: Eula7
data.value: If users encounter any issues during use, they can provide feedback via official email or by submitting an Issue in the software's GitHub repository. We will carefully consider user feedback to improve our services.

data.name: Eula9
Eula11
data.value:
The user understands and agrees that, to the extent permitted by law, the developer makes no warranties regarding this software. The risks arising from the use of this software are entirely borne by the user.
 The user understands and agrees that the developer does not guarantee that this software and services will meet the user's needs, nor does it guarantee that the service will not be interrupted, and it provides no warranties regarding the accuracy, security, or other aspects of this software and services.
 The user understands and agrees that the developer cannot fully guarantee the accuracy, security, or legality of third-party files downloaded from the online services of this Software, nor does it take responsibility for the accuracy, security, legality, etc., of third-party services within the software (including but not limited to resource downloads, etc.). Therefore, the aforementioned content is unrelated to the developer and this software and does not represent the position of the developer or this software. Relevant disputes should be borne by the third-party service provider.
 The user understands and agrees that if the software online services or related files downloaded by this software are used in erroneous or illegal ways, the consequences are borne by the user. If it leads to property damage, copyright, or intellectual property infringement, the developer will not be responsible and will not undertake any legal liability.
 The user understands and agrees that this software does not provide any guarantee for third-party service content. If the use of third-party services leads to property damage, copyright, or intellectual property infringement, the developer will not be responsible and will not undertake any legal liability.
 The user understands and agrees that the developer provides no guarantees or legal support for the functionality of this software. If the user engages in illegal activities or other improper behavior using the software's functionality, the risks and legal consequences are entirely borne by the user.

data.name: Eula13
data.value:
The copyright, patent rights, and other intellectual property rights of this software are owned by the developer or designated copyright holders.

 The third-party services used by this Software are owned by the relevant copyright holders, including but not limited to:
 this software is a server management and online gaming tool for Minecraft (the final interpretation rights belong to Microsoft and Mojang AB). Users must comply with its End User License Agreement (EULA) and the relevant policies implemented by NetEase in Mainland China, and must not use the game content for commercial purposes or engage in other activities prohibited by the EULA.
 This software is a server management and online gaming tool for Terraria (the final interpretation rights belong to Re-Logic and its publisher). Users must comply with its End User License Agreement (EULA) and related policies. Users must not use the game content for unauthorized commercial purposes or engage in other activities prohibited by the EULA.
 Some online file resources (such as server cores, game/server mods, and plugins) provided by this software are downloaded from official/third-party sources, and copyright is handled according to third-party platform regulations.
 Other third-party services used by this software have their copyrights owned by the service providers.
 This software is open-source, and users or other software developers not associated with this software must comply with its open-source license.
 The user understands and agrees that, except for resources created by the user, all online service data provided by this software are owned by the developer. The developer has the right to decide whether to retain all or part of the data on the server.

data.name: Eula15
data.value: The developer has the right to modify this EULA when necessary. If there are changes to this EULA, the developer will display the modifications on important pages. If the user does not agree with the revisions or updates to this EULA, they are able to choose to stop using the software and services. If the user continues to use the software and services after the EULA has been revised, it signifies the user's acceptance of all the changes or updates to the EULA. The developer will not be liable for any losses incurred by the user due to unfamiliarity with the changes after the EULA has been revised.

data.name: Eula17
Eula19
data.value: If any provision of this EULA is regarded as invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions should still remain in full force and effect.

data.value: Please select the instance type that you want to create:

data.value: Whatever you want, is here to be found. (Currently using

data.value: Striving our utmost, answering every question.

data.name: Settings_AutoAcceptMinecraftJavaEula_Title
data.value: Auto Accept Minecraft's EULA (Minecraft Java Edition Server Instance)

data.name: Settings_AutoAcceptMinecraftJavaEula_Description
data.value: Automatically agree the EULA means you comply with the Minecraft EULA and acknowledge that MCSL assumes no joint liability.

data.name: Settings_AutoDisableMinecraftJavaOnlineMode_Title
data.value: Automatically Disable Online Authentication (Minecraft Java Edition Instance)

data.name: Settings_AutoDisableMinecraftJavaOnlineMode_Description
data.value: After enabling this option, the instances of this type will automatically disable authentication from Mojang/Microsoft, and allow offline-mode Minecraft Clients to connect to the server.

data.name: Settings_AutoDisableMinecraftBedrockOnlineMode_Description
data.value: After enabling this option, the instances of this type will automatically disable authentication from Mojang/Microsoft, and allow offline-mode Minecraft Clients to connect to the server.

data.name: Settings_AutoDisableMinecraftBedrockOnlineMode_Title
data.value: Automatically Disable Online Authentication (Minecraft Bedrock Edition Instance)

data.name: Settings_UseMirrorForMinecraftForgeInstall_Title
data.value: Use Mirror for Installation (Minecraft Forge Server Instance)

data.name: Settings_UseMirrorForMinecraftNeoForgeInstall_Title
data.value: Use Mirror for Installation (Minecraft NeoForge Server Instance)

data.name: Settings_UseMirrorForMinecraftFabricInstall_Title
data.value: Use Mirror for Installation (Minecraft Fabric Server Instance)

data.name: Settings_UseMirrorForMinecraftQuiltInstall_Title
data.value: Use Mirror for Installation (Minecraft Quilt Server Instance)

data.name: Settings_UseMirrorForMinecraftLoadersInstall_Description
data.value: After enabling this option, resources will be downloaded using BMCLAPI. Recommended for Chinese users.

data.name: Settings_ResDownloadProvider_Description
data.value: Choose the resource provider in "Resource Download" page.

data.name: Settings_DownloadThreadCnt_Description
data.value: With sufficient computer performance, higher number of threads means faster download speed, Generally, setting it to 16 threads should be sufficient to meet the needs.

data.name: Settings_ActionWhenDownloadError_Description
data.value: Action should perform when download failed.

data.name: Settings_ActionWhenDeleteConfirm_Description
data.value: This can prevent instances from being deleted due to accidental operations.

data.name: Settings_AppTheme_Description
data.value: Following system changes by default, also you can set by yourself.

data.name: Settings_FollowStartupForLauncher_Description
data.value: Automatically launch this WPF app at system startup. It may cause system-sensitive operations, please add to the whitelist of the antivirus software.

data.name: Settings_CheckUpdateForLauncher_Description
data.value: Check update for this WPF app.

data.name: Settings_AutoCheckUpdateForLauncher_Description
data.value: Auto check update for this WPF application on launch.

data.name: Settings_About_LegalProtected
data.value: This project is protected by the Copyright Law of the People's Republic of China and international treaties. Unauthorized copying or distribution of this program (or any part thereof) will be subject to severe civil and criminal penalties, and will be prosecuted to the fullest extent permitted by law.

data.name: Settings_About_OpenSourceLicenseProtected
data.value: This project is published under GNU General Public License Version 3.0, with source code at

data.name: Settings_About_CertProtected
data.value: MCServerLauncher Future uses a certificate to ensure that the program has not been counterfeited or tampered with. Serial Number: 59cbf9b5207eeabb45417d148120ac9a. If there are any differences, please do not use it and report to services@mcsl.com.cn.

data.name: FirstSetup_EulaDisagreeTip
data.value: If you refuse the EULA, the application will exit.

data.name: FirstSetup_FakeEulaAgreeTip
data.value: Please make sure you have read the entire agreement before clicking Agree. You should at least scroll the agreement to the bottom.

data.name: FirstSetup_EulaAgreeTip
data.value: This signifies that you have acknowledged all the contents of this agreement.

data.name: Settings_AppLanguage_Description
data.value: Select the language used in this program.

data.name: FirstSetup_SkipConnectDaemonTip
data.value: If you do not add any MCSL Daemons, most of the functions of the software will be limited.\nYou can still connect to MCSL Daemons later in the settings.

data.name: FirstSetup_ConnectDaemonTip
data.value: All MCServerLauncher instances are handed over to daemon management. Please link daemons here.

data.name: Settings_Components_Description
data.value: Thank them sincerely for their contribution, which has provided sustained impetus to the MCSL Future.

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_BMCLAPI_Description
data.value: Provides the powerful BMCLAPI mirror system!

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_PCL2_Description
data.value: Provides the thought to get Minecraft Loader!

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_BakaXL_Description
data.value: Provides the thought to get Minecraft Quilt Loader!

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_iNKORE_Description
data.value: A lot of technical support was given in the development process!

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_MCSLQQ_Title
data.value: Friends of the MCSL QQ Group

data.name: Settings_Acknowledgments_MCSLQQ_Description
data.value: They're always accompanying us and have given us a lot of suggestions!

data.name: ConsoleCommand_FeedbackTip
data.value: Please bring a detailed error log when asking questions, otherwise everything is tantamount to driving with your eyes closed.

data.name: ErrorDialogTip
data.value: We encountered an unexpected exception, but got the following critical error message. You can continue to run the program, or restart, or close the application.

data.name: DaemonManagerTip
data.value: Secure escort, in the palm of your hand.
